text: The SNCASE SE-313 Alouette II (, Lark) is a French helicopter built between 1956 and 1975 by Société Nationale de Construction Aéronautique du Sud-Est and later by Aérospatiale. It was the first helicopter in the world that has a gas turbine for engine. It was the basis of two majors variants : SA-315 Lama and SA-316 Alouette III. == Bibliography == * Jackson, Robert, Helicopters: Military, Civilian, and Rescue Rotorcraft (The Aviation Factfile). London: Grange Books Ltd, 2005. . * Gaillard, Pierre, Avions et hélicoptères militaires d'aujourd'hui Paris, France : Larivière éditions, 1999. . * Boulay, Pierre, Les hélicoptères français, Paris, France : Larivière éditions, 1998. Category:French military aircraft Alouette 2 Category:Helicopters
title: SNCASE SE-313 Alouette II
